titleStmt.title: By the King James R. Whereas we have issued a proclamation bearing date the fourteenth day of September one thousand six hundred eighty nine, declaring, that such as should bring any wine or brandy to our camp, should be exempted from the duty payable to us out of such wine and brandy: ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benj. Tooke printer to the King's most excellent Majesty; and are to be sold at his Majesties printing house on Ormonde-Key, and the Colledge-Arms in Castle-street.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our camp near our town of Atherdee the 8th day of October 1689."
Revoking the free import of wines and spirits.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his Majesties printing house on Ormonde-Key
